preface.title: OpenStack API Reference
preface.para: Use the following OpenStack APIs in your OpenStack cloud: Identity service, Compute, Compute extensions, Image service, Block Storage, and Object Storage. You must install the packages for each API separately. After you authenticate through the Identity service API, you can use the other APIs and extensions to launch server instances, create images, assign metadata to instances and images, create containers and objects, and complete other actions in your OpenStack cloud.

To get started with the APIs, see the
OpenStack API Quick Start . For detailed information, read descriptions or specifications for each API.

chapter.title: Identity Service API 2.0
chapter.para: Gets an authentication token that permits access to the Compute API for 24 hours. The version of the Identity API is 2.0.

wadl:doc.title: Authenticate
wadl:doc.p: Returns a token when credentials are supplied. A payload of credentials must be included in the body.

wadl:doc.title: List Tenants
wadl:doc.p: Returns a list of tenants.

chapter.title: Compute API 2
chapter.para: Launches virtual machines (VMs) based on the images uploaded to the system. Also, connects to a server instance securely through SSH once it starts and reboots or resizes server instances as needed. API v1.1 is identical to API v2.

doc.title: Version Details
doc.p: Returns detailed information about this specific version of the API.

example.title: Version Details Response: XML
example.programlisting: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?> <versions xmlns:atom="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" xmlns="http://docs.openstack.org/common/api/v1.0"> <version status="CURRENT" updated="2011-01-21T11:33:21Z" id="v2.0"> <atom:link href="http://openstack.example.com/v2/" rel="self"/> </version> </versions>

doc.title: Location
doc.p: Full URL to a service or server.

doc.title: Detail Image List
doc.p: A list of supported extensions.
The ID for the tenant or account in a multi-tenancy cloud.

doc.title: List Extensions
doc.p: Lists all available extensions.

doc.p: The ID for the tenant or account in a multi-tenancy cloud.
An alias is a name for a pointer to a resource, such as a named extension.

wadl:doc.title: Get Extension
wadl:doc.para: Gets details about a specific extension. Extensions enable the introduction of new features in the API without requiring a version change and they allow the introduction of vendor-specific functionality.

example.title: Get Extension Response: XML
example.programlisting: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <extension xmlns="http://docs.openstack.org/common/api/v1.0" xmlns:atom="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" name="QuotaClasses" alias="os-quota-class-sets" namespace="http://docs.openstack.org/compute/ext/quota-classes-sets/api/v1." updated="2012-03-12T00:00:00+00:00"> <description> Quota classes management support. </description> </extension>

doc.p: The ID for the tenant or account in a multi-tenancy cloud.

doc.title: List Limits
doc.p: Returns current limits for the account.

example.title: List Limits Response: XML
example.programlisting: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?> <limits xmlns:atom="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" xmlns="http://docs.openstack.org/common/api/v1.0"> <rates> <rate regex=".*" uri="*"> <limit next-available="2012-11-27T17:22:18Z" unit="MINUTE" verb="POST" remaining="10" value="10"/> <limit next-available="2012-11-27T17:22:18Z" unit="MINUTE" verb="PUT" remaining="10" value="10"/> <limit next-available="2012-11-27T17:22:18Z" unit="MINUTE" verb="DELETE" remaining="100" value="100"/> </rate> <rate regex="^/servers" uri="*/servers"> <limit next-available="2012-11-27T17:22:18Z" unit="DAY" verb="POST" remaining="50" value="50"/> </rate> <rate regex=".*changes-since.*" uri="*changes-since*"> <limit next-available="2012-11-27T17:22:18Z" unit="MINUTE" verb="GET" remaining="3" value="3"/> </rate> <rate regex="^/os-fping" uri="*/os-fping"> <limit next-available="2012-11-27T17:22:18Z" unit="HOUR" verb="GET" remaining="12" value="12"/> </rate> </rates> <absolute> <limit name="maxServerMeta" value="128"/> <limit name="maxPersonality" value="5"/> <limit name="maxImageMeta" value="128"/> <limit name="maxPersonalitySize" value="10240"/> <limit name="maxSecurityGroupRules" value="20"/> <limit name="maxTotalKeypairs" value="100"/> <limit name="maxSecurityGroups" value="10"/> <limit name="maxTotalCores" value="20"/> <limit name="maxTotalFloatingIps" value="10"/> <limit name="maxTotalInstances" value="10"/> <limit name="maxTotalRAMSize" value="51200"/> </absolute> </limits>

doc.title: Server List
doc.p: A list of servers. Each server contains IDs, names, and links -- other attributes are omitted.
The ID for the tenant or account in a multi-tenancy cloud.

doc.title: List Servers
doc.p: Lists IDs, names, and links for all servers.
A time/date stamp for when the server last changed status.
Name of the image in URL format.
Name of the flavor in URL format.
Name of the server as a string.
UUID of the server at which you want to set a marker.
Integer value for the limit of values to return.
Value of the status of the server so that you can filter on "ACTIVE" for example.
Name of the host as a string.
List of servers.

example.title: List Servers Response: XML
example.programlisting: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?> <servers xmlns:atom="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" xmlns="http://docs.openstack.org/compute/api/v1.1"> <server name="new-server-test" id="b626796d-d585-4874-b178-78c65289bba4"> <atom:link href="http://openstack.example.com/v2/openstack/servers/b626796d-d585-4874-b178-78c65289bba4" rel="self"/> <atom:link href="http://openstack.example.com/openstack/servers/b626796d-d585-4874-b178-78c65289bba4" rel="bookmark"/> </server> </servers>

doc.title: Create Server
doc.p: Creates a server.
The name of the security group. If blank, the server is created in the "default" security group.
Use to pass configuration information or scripts upon launch. Must be Base64 encoded.
The availability zone in which to launch the server.

doc.title: server
doc.p: Server.

doc.title: imageRef
doc.p: The image reference for the desired image for your server instance.
Specify as an ID or full URL.

doc.title: flavorRef
doc.p: The flavor reference for the desired flavor for your server instance.
Specify as an ID or full URL.

doc.title: name
doc.p: The name for your created server.

doc.title: metadata
doc.p: Metadata key and value pairs. The maximum size of the metadata key and value is 255 bytes each.

doc.title: personality
doc.p: File path and contents (text only) to inject into the server at launch. The maximum size of the file path data is 255 bytes. The maximum limit refers to the number of bytes in the decoded data and not the number of characters in the encoded data.

example.title: Create Server Request: XML
example.programlisting: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?> <server xmlns="http://docs.openstack.org/compute/api/v1.1" imageRef="http://openstack.example.com/openstack/images/70a599e0-31e7-49b7-b260-868f441e862b" flavorRef="http://openstack.example.com/openstack/flavors/1" name="new-server-test"> <metadata> <meta key="My Server Name">Apache1</meta> </metadata> <personality> <file path="/etc/banner.txt"> ICAgICAgDQoiQSBjbG91ZCBkb2VzIG5vdCBrbm93IHdoeSBp dCBtb3ZlcyBpbiBqdXN0IHN1Y2ggYSBkaXJlY3Rpb24gYW5k IGF0IHN1Y2ggYSBzcGVlZC4uLkl0IGZlZWxzIGFuIGltcHVs c2lvbi4uLnRoaXMgaXMgdGhlIHBsYWNlIHRvIGdvIG5vdy4g QnV0IHRoZSBza3kga25vd3MgdGhlIHJlYXNvbnMgYW5kIHRo ZSBwYXR0ZXJucyBiZWhpbmQgYWxsIGNsb3VkcywgYW5kIHlv dSB3aWxsIGtub3csIHRvbywgd2hlbiB5b3UgbGlmdCB5b3Vy c2VsZiBoaWdoIGVub3VnaCB0byBzZWUgYmV5b25kIGhvcml6 b25zLiINCg0KLVJpY2hhcmQgQmFjaA== </file> </personality> </server>

doc.p: Metadata resource type, this is used for images and servers.

doc.p: A list of metadata.

wadl:doc.title: Create or Replace Metadata
wadl:doc.p: The metadata items set on the resource are those specified on the requests. Existing metadata items are replaced with the ones provided in the request. Metadata items, set previously, but not specified in the request are removed.
An overLimit ( 413) fault may be thrown if the maximum number of metadata items is exceeded.

example.title: Create or Replace Metadata Request: XML
Create or Replace Metadata Request: JSON
Create or Replace Metadata Response: XML

example.title: Create or Replace Metadata Response: JSON

wadl:doc.title: Update Metadata
wadl:doc.p: Updates resource metadata. Updates will replace existing metadata items with the same key. Items not explicitly mentioned in the request will not be modified. An overLimit ( 413) fault may be thrown if the operation causes the maximum number of metadata items to be exceeded.

example.title: Update Metadata Response: XML
example.programlisting: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?> <metadata xmlns="http://docs.openstack.org/compute/api/v1.1"> <meta key="kernel_id">False</meta> <meta key="ramdisk_id">nokernel</meta> <meta key="Label">UpdatedImage</meta> <meta key="architecture">x86_64</meta> <meta key="auto_disk_config">True</meta> </metadata>

doc.title: Change Password
doc.p: Changes the password for a server. Specify the changePassword action in the request body.

doc.p: Reboots the specified server. Specify the reboot action in the request body.

example.programlisting: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <rebuild xmlns="http://docs.openstack.org/compute/api/v1.1" name="foobar" imageRef="http://openstack.example.com/v1.1/32278/images/70a599e0-31e7-49b7-b260-868f441e862b" accessIPv4="1.2.3.4" accessIPv6="fe80::100" adminPass="seekr3t"> <metadata> <meta key="My Server Name">Apache1</meta> </metadata> <personality> <file path="/etc/banner.txt"> ICAgICAgDQoiQSBjbG91ZCBkb2VzIG5vdCBrbm93IHdoeSBp dCBtb3ZlcyBpbiBqdXN0IHN1Y2ggYSBkaXJlY3Rpb24gYW5k IGF0IHN1Y2ggYSBzcGVlZC4uLkl0IGZlZWxzIGFuIGltcHVs c2lvbi4uLnRoaXMgaXMgdGhlIHBsYWNlIHRvIGdvIG5vdy4g QnV0IHRoZSBza3kga25vd3MgdGhlIHJlYXNvbnMgYW5kIHRo ZSBwYXR0ZXJucyBiZWhpbmQgYWxsIGNsb3VkcywgYW5kIHlv dSB3aWxsIGtub3csIHRvbywgd2hlbiB5b3UgbGlmdCB5b3Vy c2VsZiBoaWdoIGVub3VnaCB0byBzZWUgYmV5b25kIGhvcml6 b25zLiINCg0KLVJpY2hhcmQgQmFjaA== </file> </personality> </rebuild>

example.programlisting: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?> <server xmlns:atom="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" xmlns="http://docs.openstack.org/compute/api/v1.1" status="ACTIVE" updated="2012-09-14T16:41:46Z" hostId="a0e37e3bd9f674600aabeeccb123d80ae2717ace90893d79cd4abc46" name="foobar" created="2012-09-14T16:41:45Z" userId="fake" tenantId="openstack" accessIPv4="1.2.3.4" accessIPv6="fe80::100" progress="0" id="943acea5-2fc8-4f31-bab6-8f7b9ac923ca" adminPass="seekr3t"> <image id="70a599e0-31e7-49b7-b260-868f441e862b"> <atom:link href="http://openstack.example.com/openstack/images/70a599e0-31e7-49b7-b260-868f441e862b" rel="bookmark"/> </image> <flavor id="1"> <atom:link href="http://openstack.example.com/openstack/flavors/1" rel="bookmark"/> </flavor> <metadata> <meta key="My Server Name">Apache1</meta> </metadata> <addresses> <network id="private"> <ip version="4" addr="192.168.0.3"/> </network> </addresses> <atom:link href="http://openstack.example.com/v2/openstack/servers/943acea5-2fc8-4f31-bab6-8f7b9ac923ca" rel="self"/> <atom:link href="http://openstack.example.com/openstack/servers/943acea5-2fc8-4f31-bab6-8f7b9ac923ca" rel="bookmark"/> </server>

doc.title: Resize Server
doc.p: Resizes the specified server. Specify the resize action in the request body.

doc.title: Confirm Resized Server
doc.p: Confirms a pending resize action. Specify the confirmResize action in the request body.

doc.title: Revert Resized Server
doc.p: Cancels and reverts a pending resize action. Specify the revertResize action in the request body.

doc.title: Create Image
doc.p: Creates a new image. Specify the createImage action in the request body.

doc.title: Addresses
doc.p: A list of addresses associated with a server.
The ID for the tenant or account in a multi-tenancy cloud.

doc.title: List Addresses
doc.p: Lists all server addresses.

A time/date stamp for the last changed status. Checks for changes since a previous request. Specify the changes-since time as UNIX time (the number of seconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 UTC, not counting leap seconds). If nothing has changed since the changes-since time, a 304 (Not Modified) response is returned. If data has changed, only the items changed since the specified time are returned in the response.

example.title: List Addresses Response: XML
example.programlisting: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <addresses xmlns="http://docs.openstack.org/compute/api/v1.1"> <network id="public"> <ip version="4" addr="67.23.10.132"/> <ip version="6" addr="::babe:67.23.10.132"/> <ip version="4" addr="67.23.10.131"/> <ip version="6" addr="::babe:4317:0A83"/> </network> <network id="private"> <ip version="4" addr="10.176.42.16"/> <ip version="6" addr="::babe:10.176.42.16"/> </network> </addresses>

doc.title: network_id
doc.p: Network ID.

doc.p: Lists addresses by network ID.

A time/date stamp for the last changed status. Checks for changes since a previous request. Specify the changes-since time as UNIX time (the number of seconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 UTC, not counting leap seconds). If nothing has changed since the changes-since time, a 304 (Not Modified) response is returned. If data has changed, only the items changed since the specified time are returned in the response.

chapter.title: Compute API 2 Extensions
chapter.para: Adds capabilities to the core Compute API. Use extensions to add features, MIME types, actions, states, headers, parameters, and resources to the core API. Query the Compute API to list available extensions with a GET request to v2/extensions.

section.title: Server Admin Actions
section.para: Permits administrators to perform actions on a server.

doc.p: The ID for the tenant or account in a multi-tenancy cloud.
The UUID for the server of interest to you.

wadl:doc.p: Pauses a server and changes its status to PAUSED. Specify the pause action in the request body.
Unpauses a PAUSED server and changes its status to ACTIVE. Specify the unpause action in the request body.
Suspends a server and changes its status to SUSPENDED. Specify the suspend action in the request body.
Resumes a SUSPENDED server and changes its status to ACTIVE. Specify the resume action in the request body.
Migrates a server to a host. The scheduler chooses the host. Specify the migrate action in the request body.
Resets networking on a server. Specify the resetNetwork action in the request body.
Injects network information into a server. Specify the injectNetworkInfo action in the request body.
Locks a server. Specify the lock action in the request body.
Unlocks a server. Specify the unlock action in the request body.
Backs up a server instance. Specify the createBackup action in the request body.

doc.p: Name of the backup image.
The backup type. Either 'daily' or 'weekly.'
An integer value that represents the number of backups to maintain.

wadl:doc.p: Live-migrates a server to a new host without rebooting. Specify the os-migrateLive action in the request body.

doc.p: Name of the new host.
If true, migration is blocked.
If true, disk over commit is allowed.

wadl:doc.p: Resets the state of a server to a specified state. Specify the os-resetState action in the request body.

doc.p: The desired state of a server.

wadl:doc.p: Evacuates a server from failed host. Specify the evacuate action in the request body.

doc.p: The name or ID of the host where the server is evacuated.
Required if server is on shared storage.

param.name: adminPass
param.doc: Not specified with onSharedStorage. New admin password for the evacuated instance.

section.title: Agents
section.para: Creates, updates, and deletes guest agents. Use guest agents to access files on the disk, configure networking, or run other applications or scripts in the guest while it runs. This hypervisor-specific extension is not currently enabled for KVM. Use of guest agents is possible only if the underlying service provider uses the Xen driver.

doc.p: The unique identifier of the tenant or account.

wadl:doc.title: List Agents
wadl:doc.p: Lists all agent builds.

wadl:doc.p: Deletes an existing agent build.

doc.p: The unique identifier of the tenant or account.
The unique identifier associated with the agent.

wadl:doc.title: Update Agent
wadl:doc.p: Updates an agent build.

section.title: Host Aggregates
section.para: Creates and manages host aggregates. An aggregate assigns metadata to groups of compute nodes. Aggregates are only visible to the cloud provider.

doc.p: The ID for the tenant or account in a multi-tenancy cloud.

wadl:doc.p: Lists all aggregates.
Creates an aggregate.

doc.p: Name of aggregate
Availability zone of aggregate
The ID for the tenant or account in a multi-tenancy cloud.
The ID associated with an aggregate.

wadl:doc.p: Deletes an aggregate.
Gets details about a specified aggregate.
Updates the name, and optionally the availability zone, for a specified aggregate.

doc.p: Name of aggregate.
Availability zone of aggregate.
The ID for the tenant or account in a multi-tenancy cloud.
The ID associated with an aggregate.

wadl:doc.p: Sets metadata for an aggregate.

doc.p: Metadata value to be set.

wadl:doc.p: Adds a host to an aggregate.

doc.p: Host ID to add to an aggregate, which is a collection of multiple groups of hosts that share common resources like storage and network.

wadl:doc.p: Removes a host from an aggregate.

doc.p: Host ID to add to an aggregate.

section.title: Cloudpipe
section.para: Manages virtual vpns for projects.

doc.p: The ID for the tenant or account in a multi-tenancy cloud.

wadl:doc.p: Lists cloudpipes.
Creates a cloudpipe.

doc.p: Creates the cloudpipe for the specified project ID. If omitted, the project ID defaults to the calling tenant.
The ID for the tenant or account in a multi-tenancy cloud.

wadl:doc.p: Updates the virtual private network (VPN) IP address and port for a specified cloudpipe instance.

doc.p: The VPN IP address.
The VPN port.

section.title: Server Console Output
section.para: Gets the output from the console log for a server.

doc.p: The ID for the tenant or account in a multi-tenancy cloud.
The UUID for the server of interest to you.

wadl:doc.title: Get Console Output for Server Instance.
wadl:doc.p: Gets console output.

doc.p: Number of lines to fetch from end of console log.

Get Console Output for Server Instance. Request: XML
Get Console Output for Server Instance. Response: JSON
Get Console Output for Server Instance. Response: XML

section.title: Server VNC Console
section.para: Accesses a VNC console for a specified server.

doc.p: The ID for the tenant or account in a multi-tenancy cloud.
The UUID for the server of interest to you.

wadl:doc.p: Gets a console.

doc.p: Valid values are 'novnc' and 'xvpvnc'.

section.title: Server - Extended Create
section.para: Shows extra information when you create a server.

doc.p: The ID for the tenant or account in a multi-tenancy cloud.

wadl:doc.p: Creates a server with the config_drive extended attribute.

doc.p: The name of the security group. If blank, the server is created in the "default" security group.
Use to pass configuration information or scripts upon launch. Must be Base64 encoded.
The availability zone in which to launch the server.
The name of the security group. If blank, the server is created in the "default" security group.
Use to pass configuration information or scripts upon launch. Must be Base64 encoded.
The availability zone in which to launch the server.

doc.title: imageRef
doc.p: The image reference for the desired image for your server instance.
Specify as an ID or full URL.

doc.title: flavorRef
doc.p: The flavor reference for the desired flavor for your server instance.
Specify as an ID or full URL.

doc.title: name
doc.p: The name for your created server.

doc.title: metadata
doc.p: Metadata key and value pairs. The maximum size of the metadata key and value is 255 bytes each.

doc.title: personality
doc.p: File path and contents (text only) to inject into the server at launch. The maximum size of the file path data is 255 bytes. The maximum limit refers to the number of bytes in the decoded data and not the number of characters in the encoded data.
ID of image to mount within server as a configuration drive.

doc.p: The ID for the tenant or account in a multi-tenancy cloud.

wadl:doc.title: Image ID
wadl:doc.p: Image ID stored through the image API. Typically a UUID.
Gets details for a specified image. Includes the image size.

section.title: Server IP Type
section.para: Shows the type of the IP addresses assigned to an instance. Type is either fixed or floating.

doc.p: The unique identifier of the tenant or account.
The UUID for the server of interest to you.

wadl:doc.title: Server IPs Details
wadl:doc.p: Shows the type of IP assigned to a specified server, either fixed or floating.

example.title: Server IPs Details Response: XML
example.programlisting: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?> <server xmlns:OS-EXT-IPS="http://docs.openstack.org/compute/ext/extended_ips/api/v1.1" xmlns:atom="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" xmlns="http://docs.openstack.org/compute/api/v1.1" status="ACTIVE" updated="2013-02-07T18:46:29Z" hostId="068cc5e2de14b6e533a239c6eac0a0bdedcd57cab25450a6d3da43af" name="new-server-test" created="2013-02-07T18:46:28Z" userId="fake" tenantId="openstack" accessIPv4="" accessIPv6="" progress="0" id="22e7cf4d-ab7a-4a3d-9599-7d0dbaf9ed55"> <image id="70a599e0-31e7-49b7-b260-868f441e862b"> <atom:link href="http://openstack.example.com/openstack/images/70a599e0-31e7-49b7-b260-868f441e862b" rel="bookmark"/> </image> <flavor id="1"> <atom:link href="http://openstack.example.com/openstack/flavors/1" rel="bookmark"/> </flavor> <metadata> <meta key="My Server Name">Apache1</meta> </metadata> <addresses> <network id="private"> <ip OS-EXT-IPS:type="fixed" version="4" addr="192.168.0.3"/> </network> </addresses> <atom:link href="http://openstack.example.com/v2/openstack/servers/22e7cf4d-ab7a-4a3d-9599-7d0dbaf9ed55" rel="self"/> <atom:link href="http://openstack.example.com/openstack/servers/22e7cf4d-ab7a-4a3d-9599-7d0dbaf9ed55" rel="bookmark"/> </server>

doc.p: The unique identifier of the tenant or account.

wadl:doc.p: Lists all servers showing their IPs by type, either fixed or floating.

section.title: Extended Instance Status
section.para: Shows extended status information - vm_state, task_state, and power_state - in detailed server responses.

doc.p: The ID for the tenant or account in a multi-tenancy cloud.
The UUID for the server of interest to you.

wadl:doc.title: Show Extended Status for Server
wadl:doc.p: Shows the extended status attributes - vm_state, power_state, and task_state - in the response for a specified server.

example.title: Show Extended Status for Server Response: JSON

doc.p: The ID for the tenant or account in a multi-tenancy cloud.

wadl:doc.title: List Extended Status for Servers
wadl:doc.p: Shows the extended status attributes - vm_state, power_state, and task_state - in the detailed response for all servers.

example.title: List Extended Status for Servers Response: JSON
List Extended Status for Servers Response: XML

section.title: Fixed IPs
section.para: Shows data for a specified fixed IP, such as host name, CIDR, and address. Also, reserves or frees a fixed IP.

doc.p: The ID for the tenant or account in a multi-tenancy cloud.
The fixed IP of interest to you.

wadl:doc.p: Gets data about a specified fixed IP address.

doc.p: The ID for the tenant or account in a multi-tenancy cloud.
The fixed IP of interest to you.

wadl:doc.p: Reserves a fixed IP.
Unreserves a fixed IP.

section.title: Flavor Access
section.para: Creates and gets details for private flavors. Also, lists, adds and removes tenants' access to private flavors.

doc.p: The ID for the tenant or account in a multi-tenancy cloud.

wadl:doc.p: Lists all flavors. Includes the access type, which is public or private.

example.title: Response: XML
example.programlisting: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?> <flavors xmlns:os-flavor-access="http://docs.openstack.org/compute/ext/flavor_access/api/v2" xmlns:atom="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" xmlns="http://docs.openstack.org/compute/api/v1.1"> <flavor disk="0" vcpus="1" ram="512" name="m1.tiny" id="1" os-flavor-access:is_public="True"> <atom:link href="http://openstack.example.com/v2/openstack/flavors/1" rel="self"/> <atom:link href="http://openstack.example.com/openstack/flavors/1" rel="bookmark"/> </flavor> <flavor disk="20" vcpus="1" ram="2048" name="m1.small" id="2" os-flavor-access:is_public="True"> <atom:link href="http://openstack.example.com/v2/openstack/flavors/2" rel="self"/> <atom:link href="http://openstack.example.com/openstack/flavors/2" rel="bookmark"/> </flavor> <flavor disk="40" vcpus="2" ram="4096" name="m1.medium" id="3" os-flavor-access:is_public="True"> <atom:link href="http://openstack.example.com/v2/openstack/flavors/3" rel="self"/> <atom:link href="http://openstack.example.com/openstack/flavors/3" rel="bookmark"/> </flavor> <flavor disk="80" vcpus="4" ram="8192" name="m1.large" id="4" os-flavor-access:is_public="True"> <atom:link href="http://openstack.example.com/v2/openstack/flavors/4" rel="self"/> <atom:link href="http://openstack.example.com/openstack/flavors/4" rel="bookmark"/> </flavor> <flavor disk="160" vcpus="8" ram="16384" name="m1.xlarge" id="5" os-flavor-access:is_public="True"> <atom:link href="http://openstack.example.com/v2/openstack/flavors/5" rel="self"/> <atom:link href="http://openstack.example.com/openstack/flavors/5" rel="bookmark"/> </flavor> </flavors>

wadl:doc.p: Creates a private flavor.

example.title: Request: XML
example.programlisting: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?> <flavor xmlns="http://docs.openstack.org/compute/api/v1.1" xmlns:os-flavor-access="http://docs.openstack.org/compute/ext/flavor_access/api/v1.1" name="test_flavor" ram="1024" vcpus="2" disk="10" id="10" os-flavor-access:is_public="False" />

example.title: Response: XML
example.programlisting: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?> <flavor xmlns:os-flavor-access="http://docs.openstack.org/compute/ext/flavor_access/api/v2" xmlns:atom="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" xmlns="http://docs.openstack.org/compute/api/v1.1" disk="10" vcpus="2" ram="1024" name="test_flavor" id="10" os-flavor-access:is_public="False"> <atom:link href="http://openstack.example.com/v2/openstack/flavors/10" rel="self"/> <atom:link href="http://openstack.example.com/openstack/flavors/10" rel="bookmark"/> </flavor>

doc.p: The ID for the tenant or account in a multi-tenancy cloud.
The ID of the flavor of interest to you.

wadl:doc.p: Gets the flavor access type, which is either public or private.

example.title: Response: XML
example.programlisting: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?> <flavor xmlns:os-flavor-access="http://docs.openstack.org/compute/ext/flavor_access/api/v2" xmlns:atom="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" xmlns="http://docs.openstack.org/compute/api/v1.1" disk="0" vcpus="1" ram="512" name="m1.tiny" id="1" os-flavor-access:is_public="True"> <atom:link href="http://openstack.example.com/v2/openstack/flavors/1" rel="self"/> <atom:link href="http://openstack.example.com/openstack/flavors/1" rel="bookmark"/> </flavor>

doc.p: The ID for the tenant or account in a multi-tenancy cloud.
The ID of the flavor of interest to you.

wadl:doc.p: Lists tenants with access to the specified private flavor.

doc.p: The ID for the tenant or account in a multi-tenancy cloud.
The ID of the flavor of interest to you.

wadl:doc.p: Gives the specified tenant access to the specified private flavor.
Revokes access from the specified tenant for the specified private flavor.

section.title: Flavor Extra-Specs
section.para: Lists, creates, and updates the extra-specs or keys for a flavor.

doc.p: The ID for the tenant or account in a multi-tenancy cloud.
The ID of the flavor of interest to you.

wadl:doc.p: Lists the extra-specs or keys for the specified flavor.
Creates extra-specs or keys for the specified flavor.
Updates the value of the specified extra-spec or key.

doc.p: The ID for the tenant or account in a multi-tenancy cloud.
The ID of the flavor of interest to you.

wadl:doc.p: Gets the value of the specified key.

section.title: Flavors with the rxtx_factor Extended Attribute
section.para:
Creates a flavor, gets details for a specified flavor, and lists details for available flavors. Includes the
rxtx_factor extended attribute, related to configured bandwidth cap values.

doc.p: The ID for the tenant or account in a multi-tenancy cloud.

wadl:doc.p: Creates a flavor. Includes the rxtx_factor extended attribute.

doc.p: The name for the new flavor.
The amount of RAM, in MBs, for the flavor.
The virtual CPUs, as a whole integer, for the flavor.
The amount of disk space, in GBs.
The ID for the flavor, which is a unique integer value.

Enables you to override the bandwidth cap value, which defaults to the bandwidth cap value for the network to which the flavor is attached. The new bandwidth cap is calculated by multiplying the rxtx_factor valued that you specify by the rxtx_base property for the network.

example.title: Request: XML
example.programlisting: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <flavor xmlns="http://docs.openstack.org/compute/api/v1.1" xmlns:OS-FLV-EXT-DATA="http://docs.openstack.org/compute/ext/flavor_extra_data/api/v1.1" name="flavortest" ram="1024" vcpus="2" disk="10" id="100" rxtx_factor="2.0"/>

example.title: Response: XML
example.programlisting: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?> <flavor xmlns:atom="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" xmlns="http://docs.openstack.org/compute/api/v1.1" disk="10" vcpus="2" ram="1024" name="flavortest" id="100" rxtx_factor="2.0"> <atom:link href="http://openstack.example.com/v2/openstack/flavors/100" rel="self"/> <atom:link href="http://openstack.example.com/openstack/flavors/100" rel="bookmark"/> </flavor>

doc.p: The ID for the tenant or account in a multi-tenancy cloud.
The flavor ID.

wadl:doc.p: Gets details for a specified flavor. Includes the rxtx_factor extended attribute.

example.title: Response: XML
example.programlisting: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?> <flavor xmlns:atom="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" xmlns="http://docs.openstack.org/compute/api/v1.1" disk="0" vcpus="1" ram="512" name="m1.tiny" id="1" rxtx_factor="1.0"> <atom:link href="http://openstack.example.com/v2/openstack/flavors/1" rel="self"/> <atom:link href="http://openstack.example.com/openstack/flavors/1" rel="bookmark"/> </flavor>

doc.p: The ID for the tenant or account in a multi-tenancy cloud.

wadl:doc.p: Lists details for available flavors. Includes the rxtx_factor extended attribute.

example.title: Response: XML
example.programlisting: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?> <flavors xmlns:atom="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" xmlns="http://docs.openstack.org/compute/api/v1.1"> <flavor disk="0" vcpus="1" ram="512" name="m1.tiny" id="1" rxtx_factor="1.0"> <atom:link href="http://openstack.example.com/v2/openstack/flavors/1" rel="self"/> <atom:link href="http://openstack.example.com/openstack/flavors/1" rel="bookmark"/> </flavor> <flavor disk="20" vcpus="1" ram="2048" name="m1.small" id="2" rxtx_factor="1.0"> <atom:link href="http://openstack.example.com/v2/openstack/flavors/2" rel="self"/> <atom:link href="http://openstack.example.com/openstack/flavors/2" rel="bookmark"/> </flavor> <flavor disk="40" vcpus="2" ram="4096" name="m1.medium" id="3" rxtx_factor="1.0"> <atom:link href="http://openstack.example.com/v2/openstack/flavors/3" rel="self"/> <atom:link href="http://openstack.example.com/openstack/flavors/3" rel="bookmark"/> </flavor> <flavor disk="80" vcpus="4" ram="8192" name="m1.large" id="4" rxtx_factor="1.0"> <atom:link href="http://openstack.example.com/v2/openstack/flavors/4" rel="self"/> <atom:link href="http://openstack.example.com/openstack/flavors/4" rel="bookmark"/> </flavor> <flavor disk="160" vcpus="8" ram="16384" name="m1.xlarge" id="5" rxtx_factor="1.0"> <atom:link href="http://openstack.example.com/v2/openstack/flavors/5" rel="self"/> <atom:link href="http://openstack.example.com/openstack/flavors/5" rel="bookmark"/> </flavor> </flavors>

section.title: Flavors with Extended Attributes
section.para:
Creates a flavor, gets details for a flavor, and lists details for available flavors. Includes the
rxtx_factor,
OS-FLV-EXT-DATA:ephemeral, and
swap extended attributes.

doc.p: The ID for the tenant or account in a multi-tenancy cloud.

wadl:doc.p: Creates a flavor. Includes the rxtx_factor, OS-FLV-EXT-DATA:ephemeral, and swap extended attributes.

doc.p: The name for the flavor.
The amount of RAM, in MBs, for the flavor.
The virtual CPUs, in a whole integer amount, for the flavor.
The amount of disk space, in GBs, for the flavor.
The ID, a unique integer value, for the flavor.

Enables you to override the bandwidth cap value, which defaults to the bandwidth cap value for the network to which the flavor is attached. The new bandwidth cap is calculated by multiplying the rxtx_factor valued that you specify by the rxtx_base property for the network.
The size of secondary drive, in GBs, to attach to a server.
The amount of swap disk space, in GBs, to allocate to a server.

example.title: Request: XML
example.programlisting: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <flavor xmlns="http://docs.openstack.org/compute/api/v1.1" xmlns:OS-FLV-EXT-DATA="http://docs.openstack.org/compute/ext/flavor_extra_data/api/v1.1" name="flavortest" ram="1024" vcpus="2" disk="10" id="666" swap="5" rxtx_factor="2.0" OS-FLV-EXT-DATA:ephemeral="30" />

example.title: Response: XML
example.programlisting: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?> <flavor xmlns:OS-FLV-EXT-DATA="http://docs.openstack.org/compute/ext/flavor_extra_data/api/v1.1" xmlns:atom="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" xmlns="http://docs.openstack.org/compute/api/v1.1" disk="10" vcpus="2" ram="1024" name="flavortest" id="666" OS-FLV-EXT-DATA:ephemeral="30"> <atom:link href="http://openstack.example.com/v2/openstack/flavors/666" rel="self"/> <atom:link href="http://openstack.example.com/openstack/flavors/666" rel="bookmark"/> </flavor>

doc.p: The ID for the tenant or account in a multi-tenancy cloud.
The ID of the flavor of interest to you.

example.title: List Floating IPs Response: XML
example.programlisting: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?> <floating_ips> <floating_ip instance_id="None" ip="10.10.10.1" fixed_ip="None" id="1" pool="nova"/> <floating_ip instance_id="None" ip="10.10.10.2" fixed_ip="None" id="2" pool="nova"/> </floating_ips>

wadl:doc.p: Allocates a new floating IP address to a tenant or account.

example.title: Allocate Floating IP Response: XML
example.programlisting: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?> <floating_ip instance_id="None" ip="10.10.10.1" fixed_ip="None" id="1" pool="nova"/>

doc.p: If there are no floating IPs available, the extension returns an error code 400 with a message indicating that no more floating IPs are available.

section.title: Server List Actions or Get Action Details
section.para: Permits all users to list available actions for a specified server. Permits administrators to get details for a specified action for a specified server.

doc.p: The ID for the tenant or account in a multi-tenancy cloud.
The UUID of the server instance for which you want to list actions.

wadl:doc.title: Get Server Actions
wadl:doc.p:
Lists available actions for a specified server. Deployers set permissions for this request in the
policy.json file. By default, all users can list actions.

example.title: Get Server Actions Response: XML
example.programlisting: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?> <instanceActions> <instanceAction instance_uuid="b48316c5-71e8-45e4-9884-6c78055b9b13" user_id="789" start_time="2012-12-05 01:00:00.000000" request_id="req-25517360-b757-47d3-be45-0e8d2a01b36a" action="resize" message="" project_id="842"/> <instanceAction instance_uuid="b48316c5-71e8-45e4-9884-6c78055b9b13" user_id="789" start_time="2012-12-05 00:00:00.000000" request_id="req-3293a3f1-b44c-4609-b8d2-d81b105636b8" action="reboot" message="" project_id="147"/> </instanceActions>

doc.p: The ID for the tenant or account in a multi-tenancy cloud.
The UUID of the server instance for which you want to list actions.

doc.title: Get Action Details
doc.p: The UUID of the action for which you want to get details.

wadl:doc.title: Get Action Details
wadl:doc.para:

policy.json file. By default, only administrators can get details for an action.

example.title: Get Action Details Response: XML
example.programlisting: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?> <instanceAction instance_uuid="b48316c5-71e8-45e4-9884-6c78055b9b13" user_id="789" start_time="2012-12-05 00:00:00.000000" request_id="req-3293a3f1-b44c-4609-b8d2-d81b105636b8" action="reboot" message="" project_id="147"> <events finish_time="2012-12-05 01:02:00.000000" start_time="2012-12-05 01:00:02.000000" traceback="" event="schedule" result="Success"/> <events finish_time="2012-12-05 01:04:00.000000" start_time="2012-12-05 01:03:00.000000" traceback="" event="compute_create" result="Success"/> </instanceAction>

chapter.title: Image Service API 1
chapter.para: Loads images for use at launch time by the Compute API. Also, assigns metadata to images. Some cloud implementations do not expose this API and offer pretested images only.

wadl:doc.title: List Image
wadl:doc.p: Lists public VM images.

doc.p: Name of the image as a string.
Value of the container format, such as ovf, bare, aki, ari, or ami.
Value of the disk format.
Filters on the status of the image, such as queued, saving, active, killed, deleted, and pending_delete.
Value of the minimum size of the image in bytes.
Value of the maximum size of the image in bytes.

wadl:doc.title: create Image
wadl:doc.p: Registers a virtual machine (VM) image.

wadl:doc.title: Images name
wadl:doc.p: Name for the image. Note that the name of an image is not unique to a Glance node. The API cannot expect users to know the names of images owned by others.

wadl:doc.title: Image disk format
wadl:doc.p: Valid values are: aki, ari, ami, raw, iso, vhd, vdi, qcow2, or vmdk.
The disk format of a VM image is the format of the underlying disk image. Virtual appliance vendors have different formats for laying out the information contained in a VM disk image.
You can set the container format for your image to one of the following values:

li.p: VHD disk format, a common disk format used by VM monitors from VMWare, Xen, Microsoft, VirtualBox, and others.
A common disk format that supported by many VM monitors.
Supported by VirtualBox VM monitor and the QEMU emulator.
An archive format for the data contents of an optical disc, such as CDROM.
Supported by the QEMU emulator that can expand dynamically and supports Copy on Write.

wadl:doc.title: Container Formats
wadl:doc.p: The container format refers to whether the VM image is in a file format that also contains metadata about the actual VM.
Container formats include: OVF and Amazon’s AMI. In addition, a VM image might not have a container format – instead, the image is just a blob of unstructured data.
You can set the container format to one of the following:

li.p: No container or metadata envelope for the image.

wadl:doc.title: Image Location
wadl:doc.p: A location for the image identified by a URI.

wadl:doc.title: List Detail Image
wadl:doc.p: Lists all details for available images.

doc.p: Name of the image as a string.
Value of the container format, such as ovf, bare, aki, ari, or ami.
Value of the disk format.
Filter on the status of the image, such as queued, saving, active, killed, deleted, and pending_delete.
Value of the minimum size of the image in bytes.
Value of the maximum size of the image in bytes.

wadl:doc.title: Next
wadl:doc.p: Show the next item in the list.

wadl:doc.title: Previous
wadl:doc.p: Show the previous item in the list.

wadl:doc.title: Image ID
wadl:doc.p: Image ID stored through the image API. Typically a UUID.

wadl:doc.title: Get Image Details
wadl:doc.p: Shows details for the specified image.

wadl:doc.title: update Image
wadl:doc.p: Updates an image, uploads an image file, or updates metadata for an image.

wadl:doc.title: Delete Image
wadl:doc.p: Deletes the specified image.

wadl:doc.title: Image ID
wadl:doc.p: Image ID stored through the image API. Typically a UUID.

wadl:doc.title: Replace Member
wadl:doc.p: Replaces a membership list for an image.

wadl:doc.title: Image ID
wadl:doc.p: Image ID stored through the image API. Typically a UUID.

wadl:doc.title: Image ID
wadl:doc.p: Owner ID, which is the same as the tenant ID.

wadl:doc.title: Delete Image
wadl:doc.p: Adds a member to an image.
If you omit the request body from this call, this request adds the membership to the image, leaves the existing memberships unmodified, and defaults new memberships to have can_share set to false.

wadl:doc.title: can_share
wadl:doc.p: To give an owner access to a private image, set to true. The owner ID is the tenant ID.

wadl:doc.title: Delete Image
wadl:doc.p: Removes a member from an image.
ID of member with whom an image is shared.

wadl:doc.title: List Shared Images
wadl:doc.p: Lists the VM images shared with a specified owner. The owner ID is the tenant ID.

wadl:doc.title: Image ID
wadl:doc.p: Owner ID. The owner ID is the tenant ID.

wadl:doc.title: Image ID
wadl:doc.p: The ID of the image that is shared with the specified owner. The owner ID is the tenant ID.

wadl:doc.title: Can Share Flag
wadl:doc.p: If the owner is authorized to further share the image, the can_share field is set to true. The owner ID is the tenant ID.

Show Volume Type Information Response: XML

doc.p: The unique identifier of the tenant or account.

wadl:doc.title: Create Snapshot
wadl:doc.p: Creates a snapshot, which is a point-in-time copy of a volume. You can create a new volume from the snapshot.

doc.p: A partial representation of a snapshot used in the creation process.
The ID of the volume to snapshot.
[True/False] Indicate whether to snapshot, even if the volume is attached. Default==False.
Name of the snapshot. Default==None.
Description of snapshot. Default==None.

example.title: Create Snapshot Request: XML
example.programlisting: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <snapshot xmlns="http://docs.openstack.org/openstack-block-storage/2.0/content" name="snap-001" description="Daily backup" volume_id="5aa119a8-d25b-45a7-8d1b-88e127885635" force="true"/>

example.title: Create Snapshot Response: XML
example.programlisting: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?> <snapshot status="creating" description="Daily backup" created_at="2013-02-25T03:56:53.081642" volume_id="5aa119a8-d25b-45a7-8d1b-88e127885635" size="1" id="ffa9bc5e-1172-4021-acaf-cdcd78a9584d" name="snap-001"> <metadata/> </snapshot>

wadl:doc.title: List Snapshots
wadl:doc.p: Lists summary information for all Cinder snapshots that are accessible to the tenant who submits the request.

example.title: List Snapshots Response: XML
example.programlisting: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?> <snapshots> <snapshot status="available" description="Very important" created_at="2013-02-25 04:13:17" volume_id="5aa119a8-d25b-45a7-8d1b-88e127885635" size="1" id="2bb856e1-b3d8-4432-a858-09e4ce939389" name="snap-001"> <metadata/> </snapshot> <snapshot status="available" description="Weekly backup" created_at="2013-02-25 07:20:38" volume_id="806092e3-7551-4fff-a005-49016f4943b1" size="1" id="e820db06-58b5-439d-bac6-c01faa3f6499" name="snap-002"> <metadata/> </snapshot> </snapshots>

doc.p: The unique identifier of the tenant or account.

wadl:doc.title: List Snapshots (Detailed)
wadl:doc.p: Lists detailed information for all Cinder snapshots that are accessible to the tenant who submits the request.

example.title: List Snapshots (Detailed) Response: XML
example.programlisting: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?> <snapshots xmlns:os-extended-snapshot-attributes="http://docs.openstack.org/openstack-block-storage/2.0/content/Extended_Snapshot_Attributes.html"> <snapshot status="available" description="Daily backup" created_at="2013-02-25 07:30:12" volume_id="5aa119a8-d25b-45a7-8d1b-88e127885635" size="30" id="43f20e0e-2c2c-4770-9d4e-c3d769ae5470" name="snap-001" os-extended-snapshot-attributes:project_id="0c2eba2c5af04d3f9e9d0d410b371fde" os-extended-snapshot-attributes:progress="100%"> <metadata/> </snapshot> <snapshot status="available" description="Weekly backup" created_at="2013-02-25 07:20:38" volume_id="806092e3-7551-4fff-a005-49016f4943b1" size="1" id="e820db06-58b5-439d-bac6-c01faa3f6499" name="snap-002" os-extended-snapshot-attributes:project_id="0c2eba2c5af04d3f9e9d0d410b371fde" os-extended-snapshot-attributes:progress="100%"> <metadata/> </snapshot> </snapshots>

doc.p: The unique identifier of the tenant or account.
The unique identifier of an existing snapshot.

wadl:doc.title: Show Snapshot
wadl:doc.p: Shows information for a specified snapshot.

example.title: Show Snapshot Response: XML
example.programlisting: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?> <snapshot xmlns:os-extended-snapshot-attributes="http://docs.openstack.org/openstack-block-storage/2.0/content/Extended_Snapshot_Attributes.html" status="available" description="Very important" created_at="2013-02-25 04:13:17" volume_id="5aa119a8-d25b-45a7-8d1b-88e127885635" size="1" id="2bb856e1-b3d8-4432-a858-09e4ce939389" name="snap-001" os-extended-snapshot-attributes:project_id="0c2eba2c5af04d3f9e9d0d410b371fde" os-extended-snapshot-attributes:progress="100%"> <metadata/> </snapshot>

wadl:doc.title: Update Snapshot
wadl:doc.p: Updates a specified snapshot.

doc.p: Describes the snapshot.
The name of the snapshot.

example.title: Update Snapshot Request: XML
example.programlisting: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <snapshot xmlns="http://docs.openstack.org/openstack-block-storage/2.0/content" name="snap-002" description="This is yet, another snapshot."/>

example.title: Update Snapshot Response: XML
example.programlisting: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?> <snapshot xmlns:os-extended-snapshot-attributes="http://docs.openstack.org/openstack-block-storage/2.0/content/Extended_Snapshot_Attributes.html" status="available" description="This is yet, another snapshot" created_at="2013-02-20T08:11:34.000000" volume_id="2402b902-0b7a-458c-9c07-7435a826f794" size="1" id="4b502fcb-1f26-45f8-9fe5-3b9a0a52eaf2" name="vol-002" os-extended-snapshot-attributes:project_id="0c2eba2c5af04d3f9e9d0d410b371fde" os-extended-snapshot-attributes:progress="100%"> <metadata/> </snapshot>

wadl:doc.title: Delete Snapshot
wadl:doc.p: Deletes a specified snapshot.

chapter.title: Object Storage API 1.0
chapter.para: Manages the accounts, containers, and objects in the object storage system.

doc.p: The unique identifier of the tenant.

wadl:doc.title: List Containers
wadl:doc.p: Lists storage containers, sorted by name.

doc.p: The number limit of results.
Marker value. Operation returns object names that are greater than this value.
End marker value. Operation returns object names that are less than this value.
Value of the serialized response format. Either json or xml.

wadl:doc.title: Retrieve Account Metadata
wadl:doc.p: Gets container metadata, such as the number of containers and the total bytes stored in OpenStack Object Storage, for the tenant.

doc.p: The number of containers. Stored in header.
The count of bytes used in total. Stored in header.

example.title: Retrieve Account Metadata Response: application/http
example.programlisting: HTTP/1.1 204 No Content Date: Thu, 07 Jun 2010 18:57:07 GMT Server: Apache X-Account-Container-Count: 3 X-Account-Bytes-Used: 323479

wadl:doc.title: Create/Update Account Metadata
wadl:doc.p: Creates or updates account metadata by associating custom metadata headers with the account level URI. These headers must have the format, X-Account-Meta-*.

doc.p: The account metadata. The asterisk (*) represents the name of metadata. Stored in header.

example.title: Create/Update Account Metadata Request: application/http
example.programlisting: POST /v1/<account> HTTP/1.1 Host: storage.clouddrive.com X-Auth-Token: eaaafd18-0fed-4b3a-81b4-663c99ec1cbb X-Account-Meta-Book: MobyDick X-Account-Meta-Subject: Whaling

doc.p: The unique identifier of the tenant.
The unique identifier of the container.

wadl:doc.title: List Objects
wadl:doc.p: Lists the objects stored in the container.

doc.p: The number limit of results.
Value of the marker, that the object names greater in value than are returned.
Value of the marker, that the object names less in value than are returned.
Value of the prefix, which the returned object names begin with.
Value of the serialized response format, either json or xml.
Value of the delimiter, that all the object names nested in the container are returned.

wadl:doc.title: Create Container
wadl:doc.p: Creates a container.

doc.p: The custom container metadata. The asterisk (*) represents the name of metadata. Stored in header.

example.title: Create Container Request: application/http
example.programlisting: PUT /v1/<account>/<container> HTTP/1.1 Host: storage.clouddrive.com X-Auth-Token: eaaafd18-0fed-4b3a-81b4-663c99ec1cbb X-Container-Meta-InspectedBy: JackWolf

wadl:doc.title: Delete Container
wadl:doc.p: Deletes an empty container.

wadl:doc.title: Get Container Metadata
wadl:doc.p: Gets container metadata, including the number of objects and the total bytes of all objects stored in the container.

doc.p: The number of objects. (stored in header)
The count of bytes used in total. (stored in header)

example.title: Get Container Metadata Response: application/http
example.programlisting: HTTP/1.1 204 No Content Date: Wed, 11 Jul 2010 19:37:41 GMT Content-type: text/html X-Container-Object-Count: 7 X-Container-Bytes-Used: 413 X-Container-Meta-InspectedBy: JackWolf

wadl:doc.title: Create or Update Container Metadata
wadl:doc.p: Creates or updates the arbitrary container metadata by associating custom metadata headers with the container level URI. These headers must have the format, X-Container-Meta-*.

doc.p: The container metadata. * represents the name of metadata. Stored in header.

example.title: Create or Update Container Metadata Request: application/http
example.programlisting: POST /v1/<account>/<container> HTTP/1.1 Host: storage.clouddrive.com X-Auth-Token: eaaafd18-0fed-4b3a-81b4-663c99ec1cbb X-Container-Meta-Book: MobyDick X-Container-Meta-Subject: Whaling

doc.p: The unique identifier of the tenant.
The unique identifier of the container.
The unique identifier of the object.

wadl:doc.title: Get Object Data
wadl:doc.p: Gets data for the specified object.

example.title: Get Object Data Response: application/http
example.programlisting: HTTP/1.1 200 Ok Date: Wed, 11 Jul 2010 19:37:41 GMT Server: Apache Last-Modified: Fri, 12 Jun 2010 13:40:18 GMT ETag: b0dffe8254d152d8fd28f3c5e0404a10 Content-type: text/html Content-Length: 512000 [ ...object content... ]

wadl:doc.title: Create or Update Object
wadl:doc.p: Creates or updates the content and metadata for a specified object.

doc.p: The MD5 checksum of your object's data. (stored in header)
The new browser behavior for the file, so that the downloader can save the file rather than displaying it using default browser settings. Stored in header.
The underlying media type of the compressed file. Stored in header.
The certain date, in the format of a Unix Epoch timestamp, when the object will be removed. Stored in header.
The certain date, in the format of a Unix Epoch timestamp, after which the object will be removed. Stored in header.
The custom object metadata. * represents the name of metadata. Stored in header.

example.title: Create or Update Object Request: application/http
example.programlisting: PUT /v1/<account>/<container>/<object> HTTP/1.1 Host: storage.swiftdrive.com X-Auth-Token: eaaafd18-0fed-4b3a-81b4-663c99ec1cbb ETag: 8a964ee2a5e88be344f36c22562a6486 Content-Length: 512000 X-Delete-At: 1339429105 Content-Disposition: attachment; filename=platmap.mp4 Content-Type: video/mp4 Content-Encoding: gzip X-Object-Meta-PIN: 1234 [ ...object content... ]

wadl:doc.title: Delete Object
wadl:doc.p: Permanently deletes an object from the OpenStack Object Storage system. In combination with the COPY command, you can use COPY and then DELETE to effectively move an object.

wadl:doc.title: Copy Object
wadl:doc.p: Copies an object to another object with a new name in the OpenStack Object Storage system.

doc.p: The container and object name of the destination object in the form of “/container/object”. (stored in header)

example.title: Copy Object Request: application/http
example.programlisting: PUT /v1/<account>/<container>/<destobject> HTTP/1.1 Host: storage.swiftdrive.com X-Auth-Token: eaaafd18-0fed-4b3a-81b4-663c99ec1cbb X-Copy-From: /<container>/<sourceobject> Content-Length: 0

wadl:doc.title: Get Object Metadata
wadl:doc.p: Gets object metadata and other standard HTTP headers.

example.title: Get Object Metadata Response: application/http
example.programlisting: HTTP/1.1 200 OK Date: Thu, 07 Jun 2010 20:59:39 GMT Server: Apache Last-Modified: Fri, 12 Jun 2010 13:40:18 GMT ETag: 8a964ee2a5e88be344f36c22562a6486 Content-Length: 512000 Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8 X-Object-Meta-Meat: Bacon X-Object-Meta-Fruit: Bacon X-Object-Meta-Veggie: Bacon X-Object-Meta-Dairy: Bacon

wadl:doc.title: Update Object Metadata
wadl:doc.p: Updates arbitrary key/value metadata. Metadata must be in the format X-Object-Meta-*. You can also assign X-Delete-At or X-Delete-After to expiring objects. You cannot use this operation to change other headers, such as Content-Type.

doc.p: The container metadata. * represents the name of metadata. Stored in header.
The certain date, in the format of a Unix Epoch timestamp, when the object will be removed. Stored in header.
The certain date, in the format of a Unix Epoch timestamp, after which the object will be removed. Stored in header.

example.title: Update Object Metadata Request: application/http
example.programlisting: POST /v1/<account>/<container>/<object> HTTP/1.1 Host: storage.swiftdrive.com X-Auth-Token: eaaafd18-0fed-4b3a-81b4-663c99ec1cbb X-Object-Meta-Fruit: Apple X-Object-Meta-Veggie: Carrot
